Vulnerability.Title: sysstat bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The sysstat packages provide the sar and iostat commands. These commands enable system monitoring of disk, network, and other I/O activity. This update fixes the following bugs: Prior to this update, the sa2 script did not support the .xz files compression. Consequently, old daily files were not deleted. With this update, sa2 supports compression of .xz files, and the old files are therefore deleted as expected. (BZ#1097294) Before this update, the sysstat utility did not check daily data files from the previous month. As a consequence, sysstat appended new data to old sar daily data files in some cases when the program logic met a boundary condition. With this update, sysstat checks whether the old sar daily data file exists, thus fixing the bug. (BZ#1100365) Previously, the dyn-tick kernel feature could make fields in the /proc/stat file unreliable. Consequently, fields in /proc/stat became unassigned, and sysstat commands could thus show overflowed values. This update implements a workaround which detects the aforementioned fields, and as a result, the sysstat commands no longer show overflowed values. (BZ#1128569) Previously, in the iostat(1) and sar(1) manual pages, the description of the %util field was incorrect. This update fixes the description of the aforementioned field, and documentation of iostat and sar is now correct. (BZ#1162773) Due to an uninitialized variable for single-core machines, the cifsiostat and nfsiostat utilities did not report the correct number of open files. With this update, the variable is initialized correctly, and the aforementioned utilities now report the correct number of open files. (BZ#1146081) In addition, this update adds the following enhancements: With this update, the user is able to set a data file compression method in the /etc/sysconfig/sysstat configuration file using the ZIP variable. This enhancement provides an easier configuration of the data file compression method. (BZ#1102610) With this enhancement, the sysstat(5) manual pages have been updated to provide a detailed description of the HISTORY configuration variable. (BZ#1110852) Users of sysstat are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
